title: View that include R libraries require setting R_LIBS

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

When I create a view that includes R libraries, I was surprised to find them linked into the top level of the view and not into the R installation.

Python packages, on the other hand, seem to be linked into `lib/python3.7/site-packages`, as if they were "activated".

```console
# given a Spack installation that includes R and r-packrat and Python and py-pip
$ spack view symlink ape -i r r-packrat python@3.7.6 py-pip^python@3.7.6
# try loading the packrat library
$ R
# at the R prompt, try `library(packrat)`, note failure :(
# exit back to your shell
$ R_LIBS=$(pwd)/ape/rlib/R/library R
# at the R prompt, try `library(packrat)`, note success :)
# exit back to your shell
# 
# note where pip was installed....
$ find ape/ | grep /pip/ | head
```


### Additional information

```
spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.1-901-32869648e
* **Python:** 3.7.6
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-skylake_avx512
```

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
